Job Title: Store Team Leader

Location: San Antonio, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
About Oportun

Oportun (Nasdaq: OPRT) is a digital banking platform that puts its 1.9 million members' financial goals within reach. With intelligent borrowing, savings, budgeting, and spending capabilities, Oportun empowers members with the confidence to build a better financial future. Since inception, Oportun has provided more than $15.5 billion in responsible and affordable credit, saved its members more than $2.3 billion in interest and fees, and helped our members save an average of more than $1,800 annually. For more information, visit Oportun.com .

  WORKING AT OPORTUN  

Working at Oportun means enjoying a differentiated experience of being part of a team that fosters a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where we all feel a sense of belonging and are encouraged to share our perspectives. This inclusive culture is directly connected to our organization's performance and ability to fulfill our mission of delivering affordable credit to those left out of the financial mainstream. We celebrate and nurture our inclusive culture through our employee resource groups.

Position Overview

As a Store Team Lead, you will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of a single store and ensuring consistent, high-quality customer service and sales. You will supervise and coach a team of Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) to meet and exceed sales goals and ensure that all processes and procedures are followed. In this role, you will also be responsible for participating in community outreach and building relationships within the local community. This is a unique opportunity to make a positive and lasting impact on the financial well-being of your community.

Responsibilities

 Welcome customers with a warm greeting and provide excellent customer service  Respond to customer inquiries or complaints in an empathetic manner  Work with the team to achieve daily sales targets  Plan and execute targeted outreach and promotional activities, including researching locations and venues to promote our products  Schedule and manage in-store promotional activities  Identify and escalate any issues involving store personnel or customer experience to the appropriate senior leadership or HR personnel  Light housekeeping generally consisting of daily collection of trash from the trash bins in the store and disposing of it in a designated area, sweeping or vacuuming (where carpet is present) the showroom daily, mopping with Swiffer floor mop 1-2 times per week or as needed, and cleaning windows as needed.  Serve as a role model for Oportun's Core Values: On a Mission, As One, to Make it Better, Now 

 DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 Bilingual in English and Spanish  Outgoing and sales-oriented  Valid driver's license  Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)  2+ years of sales experience and 1+ year of proven retail leadership experience as a team lead or supervisor, with a focus on people management, sales, and operations (banking experience is a plus)  Flexibility to work weekends and to adjust work schedule based on store needs 

 AS A VALUABLE MEMBER OF OUR TEAM, YOU’LL RECEIVE: 

 Medical, Dental, Vision, Life insurance  Employer-matched 401(k)  Competitive pay with sales incentives $$$  Flexible schedules  Paid Time Off  Paid Training  16 hours of volunteerism every year  Growth opportunities  Opportunity to positively affect your community 

The base hourly rate for this full-time position is $21.00 - $24.00.

 Our hourly rates are determined by role, location and experience. The hourly range displayed on each job posting reflects a minimum and maximum for new hire rates for this position, specific to the location of this job posting. 

Please note that the compensation details listed in this posting reflects only the hourly rate for this position and does not include other compensation elements or benefits.”

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider all qualified applicants for employment opportunities without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other category protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

California applicants can find a copy of Oportun's CCPA Notice here: https://oportun.com/privacy/california-privacy-notice/ .

We will never request personal identifiable information (bank, credit card, etc.) before you are hired. We do not charge you for pre-employment fees such as background checks, training, or equipment. If you think you have been a victim of fraud by someone posing as us, please report your experience to the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3).

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
